EXTRACTED VALUE: Bladestorm does provide and incredibly well structured action-strategy game, and it juggles depth and accessibility with panache.
I think graphics junkies will probably feel a little let down when presented with the game’s visuals.
It's a novel concept but lack of control variation, plus the obvious graphical deficiencies, make it a dulled thrill. [Issue#36, p.114]
Mortal Kombat is finally in the Arcade--too bad it's in the form of Ultimate MK3. [Jan. 2007, p.75]
It’s amazingly detailed in its simplicity, easy to pick up and play and it will keep you plugging away for a bit.
The gameplay is definitely not worth the $59.99 price tag of a next generation title.
It’s a little disappointing that the feature set is so thin but it does depend on what you were planning to get out of it.
A great PS game, along the lines of "Driver," only more, shall we say, international. [June 2002, p.63]
